name: clay brick production, moulded | clay brick | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/29349/documentation

This dataset describes the production of traditional clay bricks in the area of San José de Balzay in Ecuador. The dataset represents the production of 1 kg of brick, with the following characteristics:  average weight of 4.72 kg and average dimensions of (13.5 x 26.5 x 7.75) cm (width x length x height). Data was obtained from measurements and information provided in the two factories visited, therefore the dataset contains weighted average values. Some data was calculated using literature values. The companies visits took place in March, May, and June 2022. This dataset was developed by Estefania Barros, Kristi Padrón, Jonnathan Aguirre and Juan Sebastian Martines, under the supervision of Prof. Dolores Sucozhañay and Prof. Paul Vanegas, from the Inclusive Circular Economy and Sustainable Development Research Group of the University of Cuenca (ECI) in the frame of the CEELA (Strengthening capacities for energy efficiency in buildings in Latin America) project with the support of the Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC).

The activity starts with the reception of raw materials at the clay brick production site.


This dataset ends with the storage of the produced brick at the production site. This dataset includes the reception of raw materials, dosing, mixing, forming (moulding by hand), drying, firing, cooling, and storage. The dataset does not include the packaging.
category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2392:Manufacture of clay building materials

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The time period is from 2022 (year of data collection) to 2023 (year of dataset compilation).
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data was obtained in two factories of traditional clay bricks located in San José de Balzay and Racar, Cuenca, Ecuador.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Current production technology. This dataset corresponds to artisanal manufacturing of two traditional clay bricks factories, which do not incorporate any machinery in their process. The manufacturing process includes the reception of raw materials, dosing, mixing, forming, drying, firing of wood, cooling and storage of bricks. The mixing of raw materials is done with the help of the trampling of a horse, while the forming process is done by hand by the people working in the factory.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Data are calculated as a weighted average between the data collected at the two clay brick artisanal production factories. See exchange comments for further details.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
Data gathered in two clay bricks factories through a process assessment in a technical visit. The production process of this material is artisanal and most of factories in Ecuador have a similar process and raw materials. According to a study conducted by Swisscontact in Cuenca in 2016, 89% of brick factories are considered artisanal (which produce clay brick moulded) and the rest semi-mechanized. Land occupation exchange is used as an estimate of infrastructure.

References: Venegas, O. (2018). Evaluación de la energía contenida, emisiones de CO2 y material particulado en la fabricación del ladrillo semi-mecanizado tochano en cuenca, a través del análisis de ciclo de vida (ACV). [Master degree in Constructions, University of Cuenca]. https://dspace.ucuenca.edu.ec/bitstream/123456789/29319/1/MscArqAndr%C3%A9sVenegas.pdf

exchanges.description: The dataset represents 1 kg of a solid clay brick, with measured average dimensions (13.5 x 26.5 x 7.75) cm (width x length x height) and measured average mass of 4.72 kg.

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Calculated as the difference between the amount of inputs (wood fuel and oxygen) and outputs (CO2, CO, SO2, NOx, VOC, PM10 and water) from the firing process. Wood ash is produced from the combustion of wood during the firing process.

flow.name: wood ash mixture, pure
flow.category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3821:Treatment and disposal of non-hazardous waste

defaultProvider.name: market for wood ash mixture, pure | wood ash mixture, pure | Cutoff, U
defaultProvider.category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3821:Treatment and disposal of non-hazardous waste

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Evaporated water is produced during two processes: 1) Combustion process, where water in wet mass amount in the wood chips gets evaporated (calculated as wood_fuel*water_in_wet_mass/1000); and 2) Drying process of the bricks (weight of a just made brick and a fired brick are considered).

Calculated value. Multiplying the kg of fuel (wood) per kg of clay brick by the emission factor of the pollutant (kg/kg). Based on literature calculations and information provided by the owners of the factories. Particulate matter emission is produced from combustion of wood during the firing process. PM10 emission is produced from combustion of wood during the firing process. Particulate matter is < 10 um. Reference: Jaya Sucozhañay, J. L., & Gomezcoello Vásquez, J. L. (2012). Análisis comparativo de la contaminación atmosférica producida por la combustión en ladrilleras artesanales utilizando tres tipos de combustibles (Bachelor's thesis).

Calculated value. Multiplying the number of damaged bricks by the brick mass. This value is divided by the kg of bricks produced per firing process, to obtain the kg of damaged bricks per kg of clay brick. About 241 bricks are damaged in the oven, for each firing process, as informed by the owners of the factories is considered. These bricks are used to fill holes in the ground. Therefore, the disposal is modelled as open dumping.

exchanges.description: Calculated value. The value represents the amount of eucalyptus wood used in the firing process for the production of 1 kg of clay brick as informed by the owners of the factories. Multiplying the volume of wood per kg of bricks (0.000244 m3/kg of clay brick) by wood density (730 kg/m3).

flow.name: wood chips, wet, measured as dry mass
flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/02:Forestry and logging/022:Logging/0220:Logging

defaultProvider.name: market for wood chips, wet, measured as dry mass | wood chips, wet, measured as dry mass | Cutoff, U
defaultProvider.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/02:Forestry and logging/022:Logging/0220:Logging

exchanges.description: Calculated value. The wastewater was modelled as the water difference between the amount of rainwater used in the process together with the water contained in the clay, and the water evaporated from the brick after the firing process. The water is captured in a hole in the ground, where the mixing takes place. Therefore, the excess water is infiltrated by the soil and follows a natural process, where it eventually reaches groundwater or a water body.

Calculated value. Multiplying the kg of fuel (wood) per kg of clay brick by the emission factor of the pollutant (kg/kg). Based on literature calculations and information provided by the owners of the factories. VOC emission is produced from combustion of wood during the firing process. Reference: Jaya Sucozhañay, J. L., & Gomezcoello Vásquez, J. L. (2012). Análisis comparativo de la contaminación atmosférica producida por la combustión en ladrilleras artesanales utilizando tres tipos de combustibles (Bachelor's thesis).

Calculated value. Multiplying the kg of fuel (wood) per kg of clay brick by the emission factor of the pollutant (kg/kg). Based on literature calculations and information provided by the owners of the factories. Carbon monoxide emission is produced from combustion of wood during the firing process. Reference: Jaya Sucozhañay, J. L., & Gomezcoello Vásquez, J. L. (2012). Análisis comparativo de la contaminación atmosférica producida por la combustión en ladrilleras artesanales utilizando tres tipos de combustibles (Bachelor's thesis).

Calculated value. This value represents the amount of various types of clay used for the production of 1 kg of clay brick, according to measurements and the information provided by the owners of the factories. The types of clay used are "tierra amarilla", "tierra roja" and "tierra negra". Tierra amarilla and tierra roja are more sandy, whereas tierra negra is also known as "tierra fina".

exchanges.description: Estimated for infrastructure. Land occupation calculated as the land occupied by the production facility (0.03 ha) divided by the average annual production volume of the facility (149'090 kg clay brick/year).

Calculated value. Multiplying the kg of fuel (wood) per kg of clay brick by the emission factor of the pollutant (kg/kg). Based on literature calculations and information provided by the owners of the factories. Sulfur dioxide emission is produced from combustion of wood during the firing process. Reference: Jaya Sucozhañay, J. L., & Gomezcoello Vásquez, J. L. (2012). Análisis comparativo de la contaminación atmosférica producida por la combustión en ladrilleras artesanales utilizando tres tipos de combustibles (Bachelor's thesis).

Calculated value. Multiplying the kg of fuel (wood) per kg of clay brick by the emission factor of the pollutant (kg/kg). Based on literature calculations and information provided by the owners of the factories. Carbon dioxide emission is produced from the combustion of the firing process. Reference: Alvear, P., & Palomeque, R. (2017). Análisis del inventario del ciclo de vida del ladrillo utilizado en la ciudad de Cuenca: aspectos energéticos, medio ambientales, sociales, económicos y culturales. University of Cuenca, Cuenca, Ecuador (Bachelor's thesis).

Calculated value. Water content used for the production process based on measurements and the information provided by the owners of the factories. Water used for the production of clay bricks is water obtained from the rain.

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Calculated from the total oxygen content of CO2 and CO.

Calculated value. Multiplying the kg of fuel (wood) per kg of clay brick by the emission factor of the pollutant (kg/kg). Based on literature calculations and information provided by the owners of the factories. Nitrogen oxides emission is produced from combustion of wood during the firing process. Reference: Jaya Sucozhañay, J. L., & Gomezcoello Vásquez, J. L. (2012). Análisis comparativo de la contaminación atmosférica producida por la combustión en ladrilleras artesanales utilizando tres tipos de combustibles (Bachelor's thesis).
